intro: Calceolaria endotrachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive slipper-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
